title: What are the subjects in IIT? - Quora

response.answer_text: First thing collect all necessary information related to exam, like syllabus, previous question papers to prepare a mind set what kind of questions are standard of such kind of exams, Start working on your basic level, without a solid base you will be unable to crack any exam, so you need to prepare your all basic. You need to work a lots on your all subjects, while you are studying and you are feeling boring then start reading another subjects. Try to meet face to face, who have already cracked such kind of exam, and discuss with them, it not possible to meet face to face then try to find those online and leave massages for them defiantly they will reply for you. Prepare a long term positive attitude, and make an image of success in your mind, don’t be negative that you can not do, because lots of people already have cracked exam, then why don’t you be the next? Who have passed exam before you they are not out of this planet they are also belong same planet, just think what wrong with you, why do you be confuse? You are already too daring person, today you are thinking about a well reputed exam, just busy in your study and prove again you are more daring, One day is not enough for become ready for exam, but day by day you will be able and defiantly crack your exam, Right now you are a student, then nothing is more than study, firstly do it and go ahead in life, don’t be confuse right now study is everything for you, Make it more interesting, and try to make your own innovative ideas to make easy your study. Divide your task into sub parts, and do them one by one, after finish your tasks give some rewards to yourself. If you face any kind of problems, then don’t be hesitate to tell your parents guardian, believe me they will defiantly resolve easily, what you can not do. And more things you can include in your preparation list. All the best for your bright future, which already waiting for you !!!

If you are talking about subjects for JEE Exam, then Physics, Chemistry & Mathematics are the subjects, and you should pay equal time and attention to each subject. Or if you are talking about selection of stream to select while admission, then it all depends on you, your interests, your aspirations, etc. There is long list of options available and are different for different IITs. Each IIT not offers all the subjects and is good at particular subjects only. Best of Luck Regards, Tonty
